they blatantly forgot to mention how fun it is
They didn't say a whole lot about it, just that you build rockets and it's hard.

When was the last time that you heard of an indie game being broadcasted in the news though? I think KSP is going to the stars, along with squad. They have really ignited something here. (All puns intended)

As it develops i can see KSP becoming extreamly popular. Everyone I turn on turn on to the game love it. The biggest turn offs are usually lack of planets to visit and steep learning curve (both of which will likely be fixed in .17). However most people (I know) understand the concept of WIP development and instead see the games immence potental. Hopeflly enough Kerbanaughts spread the word and KSP will become a smash mainstream sucsess! (which it totally has the potental for)

Also KSP can really inspire people about space and can be used as a learning tool! Most the most ive learned about orbital mechanics and menuvers i learned playing KSP!
